text: Maybe try Angrist and Pischke "Mastering Metrics" - it's focused on quasi linear models (difference in difference, regression discontinuity, instrumental variables) but I think does a move job getting the basics across with some more mathematical detail in appendices formalising some of the ideas. They also have "Mostly Harmless Econometrics", which covers the same topics but in slightly more detail (they say it's more targeted at grad students)
